text:
It appears that the current ant RPMs from jpackage.org do not configure ant
correctly. My setup:

[bgsmith]$ rpm -qa | grep -i ant-
ant-1.5.1-3jpp
ant-manual-1.5.1-3jpp
ant-javadoc-1.5.1-3jpp
ant-optional-full-1.5.1-3jpp

When I run ant -diagnostics I get the following. It appears the
ant-optional-full rpm does not create a symlink to ant-optional.jar. If I
manually create the symlink, then the diagnostics are more reasonable.

text:
You should have a symlink between :

/usr/share/java/ant-optional.jar -> /usr/share/java/ant-optional-full-1.5.1.jar

I you don't have, it's still a problem in %post of rpm and you should remove
ant, ant-optional-full and reinstall

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: we no longer provide RPMs, so it is time to close the component as it only causes confusion.
